A4.text: Pierre Janet originally developed the idea of dissociation of consciousness from his work with hysterical patients.

A5.text: Clark L. Hull wrote: If a subject after submitting to the hypnotic procedure shows no genuine increase in susceptibility to any suggestions whatever, there seems no point in calling him hypnotised, regardless of how fully and readily he may respond to suggestions of lid-closure and other superficial sleeping behaviour.
